channel.title: CVE Feed for QuomodoSoft -- ElementsReady Addons for Elementor
channel.description: The latest CVEs for QuomodoSoft -- ElementsReady Addons for Elementor

item.title: CVE-2024-47329|2024-10-07T13:07:59.019Z -- quomodosoft -- elementsready%20addons%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in QuomodoSoft ElementsReady Addons for Elementor allows Stored XSS.This issue affects ElementsReady Addons for Elementor: from n/a through 6.4.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-34374|2024-08-02T02:51:11.213Z -- quomodosoft -- elementsready%20addons%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in QuomodoSoft ElementsReady Addons for Elementor allows Stored XSS.This issue affects ElementsReady Addons for Elementor: from n/a through 5.8.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-5152|2024-06-06T13:07:06.503Z -- quomodosoft -- elementsready%20addons%20for%20elementor
item.description: The ElementsReady Addons for Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘_id’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 6.1.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-34374|2024-06-04T17:42:24.522Z -- quomodosoft -- elementsready%20addons%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in QuomodoSoft ElementsReady Addons for Elementor allows Stored XSS.This issue affects ElementsReady Addons for Elementor: from n/a through 5.8.0.

item.description: The ElementsReady Addons for Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘_id’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 6.1.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
